Dear.  
Freaking.  
God.  
  
So unbelievably good.  
  
This card simultaneously appeals to everyone.

Control: You have a wrath-proof undamageable 6/6.  
Combo: Their next alpha swing is moot.

posts.post_content:
Both this and Sarkhan the Mad refer to themselves as "himself" where other cards say "itself". I guess WotC really want planeswalkers to stand out, with those special frames and parts of the picture overlapping it.  
  
Anyway, nice card. His plus can either be a Fog, or open up for an alpha strike, or just set up for his minus. And the minus... well, the guy's removal! His "ultimate" is weird, but both powerful and fun. I want to see what a "guyed" Gideon looks like in Magic Online.
posts.html:
Both this and Sarkhan the Mad refer to themselves as "himself" where other cards say "itself". I guess WotC really want planeswalkers to stand out, with those special frames and parts of the picture overlapping it.

Anyway, nice card. His plus can either be a Fog, or open up for an alpha strike, or just set up for his minus. And the minus... well, the guy's removal! His "ultimate" is weird, but both powerful and fun. I want to see what a "guyed" Gideon looks like in Magic Online.

Posted By: RafiqTheMiststalker (4/22/2010 7:40:03 PM)

posts.post_content:
I really like this card.. I actually find lightmine field to not be the most amazing combination, since it would take a lot of creatures in play to even kill off something like a malakir bloodwitch, but it has such interesting combinations it makes a great combo piece.
  
   
Mostly red cards are great with this, such as kazuul tyrant of the cliffs, and fumiko. Lust for war is a nifty enchantment that works well in this regard as well.
  
   
I think people might over hype gideon for a while too, since he doesn't fit in every deck, and his ultimate is pretty awesome, but isn't that far removed from indestructibility which isn't really a big threat right now with consuming vapors, cruel edict, path to exile, iona's judgement, and many others. Also note it says damage only, not if it gets terminated or etc.
  
   
Having said all that, love the abilities, killing a tapped creature is a really nice effect on a planeswalker, the first ability is fantastic for walls, and the ultimate never hurts sinc... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I really like this card.. I actually find lightmine field to not be the most amazing combination, since it would take a lot of creatures in play to even kill off something like a malakir bloodwitch, but it has such interesting combinations it makes a great combo piece.

Mostly red cards are great with this, such as kazuul tyrant of the cliffs, and fumiko. Lust for war is a nifty enchantment that works well in this regard as well.

I think people might over hype gideon for a while too, since he doesn't fit in every deck, and his ultimate is pretty awesome, but isn't that far removed from indestructibility which isn't really a big threat right now with consuming vapors, cruel edict, path to exile, iona's judgement, and many others. Also note it says damage only, not if it gets terminated or etc.

Having said all that, love the abilities, killing a tapped creature is a really nice effect on a planeswalker, the first ability is fantastic for walls, and the ultimate never hurts sinc... (see all)

posts.post_content: @Tanaka: I'm fairly sure the rule is activated abilities of planeswalkers can only be activated once per turn and when you can play a sorcery, but if a creature gains the activated abilities of a planeswalker, they can be activated like any other activated ability of a creature, and creatures aren't affected by any loyalty counters they may have. Or did they change all that?
posts.html:
@Tanaka: I'm fairly sure the rule is activated abilities of planeswalkers can only be activated once per turn and when you can play a sorcery, but if a creature gains the activated abilities of a planeswalker, they can be activated like any other activated ability of a creature, and creatures aren't affected by any loyalty counters they may have. Or did they change all that?
